result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R. Rademaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: May transfer out of county for work purposes.  May transfer to Vernon Co.
Obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling or combination of both.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management.  No contact w/Kalahari Resorts.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  Absolute Sobriety.  Random UAs.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Commence on or before Dec. 4, 2015
Consecutive to: to any other sentence/commitment

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel R. Rademaker in court with attorney David G Makovec.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves for amendment to Count 1 - misd. THC 961.41(3g)(e).  Plea to all 3 counts.    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Counts 1 - 3:
18 months Probation, concurrent
60 days SCJ (Ct. 1 only), w/work release, consecutive, comm. on or before Dec. 4, 2015 @ 6 pm
Out of county travel for work purposes
EMP approved
May transfer to Vernon Co. 
DNA sample to be provided
Undergo any counseling per agent to include Anger Managment
AODA & treatment 
No entry into bars, taverns or business' that the main purpose of sale is alcohol or drug paraphernalia
Absolute Sobietry
No contact w/Kalahari Resort
Random UAs
Seek/maintin full time employment, education or both
$443.00 x 3 Costs  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 1.  Bond cointinues.
Defendant Daniel R. Rademaker in court with attorney David G Makovec.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.

Defendant Daniel R. Rademaker in court with attorney David G Makovec.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Makovec requests prelim.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Daniel R. Rademaker in court with attorney David G Makovec.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset 15 days.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel R. Rademaker
Current: 607 Linton St., Viroqua, WI 54665 United States  (Effective: 04-24-2015)
Prior: 670 10th Ave, # 9, Baldwin, WI 54002

Pre-trial conference at 05-15-2015 10:00 am.
Return date at 05-28-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel R. Rademaker by video from LE with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Defendant Daniel R. Rademaker in custody.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $500.00 signature bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
